attributes.action: Vehicle tax to include levy for repair of roads maintained by local authorities
attributes.background: The condition of local roads is poor.  Pot holes and bad repairs are a mounting problem that impact all road users.  The situation in places can be dangerous and cause significant costs.  A link to vehicle tax would be a link to the number of vehicles and thus provide proportionate funds.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence can be found in the budget of local authorities.  Requirements exceed funding, over many years, by large amounts.

attributes.action: Fund “Off The Street, Less Heat” youth project and similar projects
attributes.background: Off the Street, Less Heat is a youth diversion project which provides sports and other workshops to distract young people from anti-social behaviour, gang-related violence and street crime. Due to Government cuts, it and projects like it have lost funding.
attributes.additional_details: Off the Street, Less Heat was started in 2006/07 by Elaine Roberts, who came up with the name and idea, to help get young people off the streets and welcome people from all different communities. The project also aims to improve the relations between the police and the local community. Off the Street, Less Heat and similar projects all over the country need direct funding from the Government to ensure that they can continue.

attributes.action: Teach about Babylonian history in schools!
attributes.background: The babylionan civilasation contributed immensly in shaping the worlds history. They contributed to one of the earliest forms of writting, the first ever laws through the code of Hammurabi, science and astrology and maths. This should be taught in schools.

attributes.action: Start a voluntary emigration programme for people who want to leave the UK.
attributes.background: I am sick and tired of living in a small country with an ever increasing population and lack of government investment in jobs, housing, opportunities, transport, healthcare and poor standard of living.
attributes.additional_details:
You would be paid up to £100,000 by the Government to give up your British citizenship, if you’re entitled to another citizenship, in exchange for leaving the UK to settle elsewhere.

 

A contract can be signed, so that if someone changes their mind they will be liable to pay back the sum of money, if they want to gain back their citizenship. They will also not be able to join the scheme again.

attributes.action: Introduce a requirement for address verification for internet applications
attributes.background: We've got to get real regarding issues with Bots and third-party actors on social networks and other internet applications. The hate and anger we are seeing online must be stopped and one of the only tools we have to do so is to make people prove who they say they are.
attributes.additional_details:
What I am proposing is this...

Any application designed for access by the general public and allowing internal messaging or commenting or any other intra-user communication must verify the postal address of users.

All applications to either filter out un-verified users by default or provide a mechanism to allow users to opt-in and opt-out of receiving messages from un-verified users. 

All existing application users to be subject to the same verification procedure within a time limit.

attributes.action: Make nonconsensual medical intervention for intersexed people illegal.
attributes.background: Data from intersex civil societies show that intersex nonconsensual surgeries are not a thing of the past. They expressed concern at unnecessary surgeries on intersex children before they can provide consent. It called on the government to stop these. This has not happened.
attributes.additional_details: About 1 in 2000 children are born with genitalia considered atypical enough to prompt medical investigation. Nonconsensual treatment, according to studies, often causes severe physical and psychological harm to patients. We need to stop nonconsensual medical interventions, as the Maltan government did, and make sure that no one has to suffer nonconsensual treatment again. Being intersex is not a bad thing. Intersex people deserve to be protected from discrimination.

attributes.action: 5 year driving ban for speads in excess of 10mph over the specified limit.
attributes.background: A driver who speeds excessively is aware of their actions. Therefore an immediate ban of 5years should be given to those driving in excess  of 10mph over the specified limit.
attributes.additional_details: Many people are killed each year by speeding drivers. If those drivers were told if they speed more than 10mph over the specified limit they would be banned from driving for 5 years. We would have a lot of people asking themselves is it rely worth the risk of 5 year  instant ban.

attributes.action: Make it an offense for essay writing services to advertise to under 16's
attributes.background: In the same way that gambling, alcohol and cigarettes are prohibited from advertising to minors, I suggest similar measures be applied to companies like UK Essays and other Essay Mills in order to protect minors from being unduly influenced by manipulative marketing practices.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Essays Website:
https://www.ukessays.com/services/essay-writing-service.php
Facebook Ad:
https://www.facebook.com/UKEssays/posts/10159836527715151
Twitter Ad:
https://twitter.com/UKEssays/status/970984231051636736

attributes.action: Start a British Foreign Legion.
attributes.background: Many British Army applicants are turned away due to their history of mental illness, certain complications such as having had a detached retina and also those with a criminal background. However The French Foreign legion could accept these failed applicants and they often prove to be great recruits.
attributes.additional_details:
So I ask that a British Foreign Legion is formed so Patriots of this country who were rejected by the British Army can serve their country, as I believe it is wrong that many patriots like my self are not given this opportunity, due to their pasts.
Just like the French Foreign legion, people who want to come to this country to make a better life for themselves could do so by serving five years in the British Foreign legion. After that time is served they can be granted British citizenship.

attributes.action: Let 15 year olds take their CBT once they reach their final school year
attributes.background: When you're 16, you can take your cbt, ride a motorcycle, buy energy drinks, and get a job, however a 15 year old in the same school year can’t do any of these things. How come you're mature enough to be in the same school year, but not to have any of the perks?
attributes.additional_details: I found it especially frustrating, having a birthday in August, I had to see teenagers, who were in the same school year and learning the same as me ride motorbikes, and get jobs, while I was stuck in a village with no transport, a friend of mine in the same school year had a motorbike and had no issue, for instance, I could have been doing motorvehicle as an apprenticeship, but not be able to get a licence until after someone who’s never driven before, even though their the same year

attributes.action: Hold a Northern Ireland referendum on whether to Remain in the EU Customs Union
attributes.background: Northern Ireland voted by a significant majority to Remain in the EU and will be one of the regions most significantly affected by withdrawal. As Sinn Fein do not take up their seats in Parliament, it would be good to go directly to the NI electorate for their views on this proposal.

attributes.action: Reduce preventable negligence cases within the NHS
attributes.background: Thousands of patients are being let down by avoidable errors made by the NHS. Errors such as failing to provide emergency care, mistakes in dispensing the correct drugs and dosages, misdiagnosis, delays in treatment, and incorrect treatment. This is harming patients and causing unnecessary deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Over the last decade, negligence claims against the NHS have quadrupled to an annual payout of £1.7 billion. This is set to double by 2021. This suggests a growing problem that isn't being dealt with effectively. Health leaders propose to address this issue by capping the amount of compensation that is paid out to victims. Yet this won't reduce the number of negligence cases. We need to invest more resources into identifying the root causes of the problem and in turn implementing a solution.

attributes.action: Instate a Queens day in honour of Queen Elizabeth the 2nd.
attributes.background: The Queen is a staple of Britain, I and many others believe she should have a bank holiday dedicated to her Highness.

attributes.action: Allow children to start school at 4
attributes.background: I have been told that my 3 year old will have to wait until he is 5 before he starts main stream school because his birthday is September(After June). Why can't children start when they are 4 or start them according to their learning and only hold them back if they need the extra help
attributes.additional_details: I personally would much rather my son have an extra year at school than an extra year in nursery.

attributes.action: "PAMPER ON PRESCRIPTION" -  health professionals to prescribe holistic therapies
attributes.background: This idea could potentially save the NHS £millions.  As a sufferer from Mental Health issues I have often felt the need for relaxation to aid my stress levels, and have personal experience that even basic massage is the best relaxant and stress reliever ***(Please read 'more details' section)***
attributes.additional_details: The massage itself works wonders, but the talking that accompanies the treatment is also very therapeutic.  e.g. a simple hand massage.  To pay for these treatments can be relatively costly for me, but if I could access the therapies regularly, I would be able to cut down on expensive medication, thereby saving the NHS money.  I can advocate this idea as I know it works.

attributes.action: Introduce a separate, higher minimum wage for temporary workers and agency staff
attributes.background:
This petition is to help address the issue of unstable employment in our economy and to help promote the concerns about zero hour and temporary contracts. 
If temporary workers were given a higher minimum wage then this could encourage employers to offer permanent contracts and reduce exploitation.

attributes.action: Ban the use of video interviews using computer analysis to select candidates
attributes.background: Many companies have began using video interviews in their application process. These interviews are reviewed by a computer and never seen by a person. The algorithms used cannot account for behavioural differences exhibited by people with disabilities and so, it removes them as viable candidates.
attributes.additional_details: Video interview algorithms are set up to analyses both verbal and non-verbal communication. The main problem with this system is that the characteristics which are deemed to be ‘good’ are generally characteristics which people with learning difficulties, such as ADHD or Aspergers will never display under the circumstances of a video interview. In an actual face to face interview, the interviewer can understand and account for the difference in communication while an algorithm cannot.

attributes.action: UK referendum on the free movement of people from European Union countries.
attributes.background:
A referendum on free movement of people from the European Union is essential. 
 Let the country decide who can come here, with a simple yes or no referendum.

attributes.action: Standardise the tax rates for employment income with all other income sources
attributes.background:
If you receive most income from your employment, there is a 99% chance that you are probably ‘poor’ or, at least, not part of the 1% high wealth individuals.
The wealthy avoid high employment income tax rates and instead exploit generous allowances and lower tax rates on all other forms of income.
attributes.additional_details:
By standardising the tax rates on all forms of income, employment tax rates will fall since the disproportionate tax benefits available to the super-rich only will be reduced to create a fair tax system.

All income say, under £1m, including receipts from loans from non-UK sources and gains from share schemes, should be treated equally for tax purposes and thereafter a minimum tax rate of 10% should cap any excessive tax breaks. 
Personal allowance and capital gain exemption could also be combined.

attributes.action: Put a tax on fish so fish can flourish more in the ocean.
attributes.background: Over fishing is declining fishes numbers so if there were a tax on buying them fishing would decline and the government would get more money.

attributes.action: Remove Foundation and Higher maths papers and make one whole paper for everyone.
attributes.background: As everyone knows, there is higher and foundation maths. Foundation is for those who aren't as able at Maths but sometimes people are wrongly placed there. Make one whole paper for everyone, you never know what people could achieve. It would be fair to everyone if we all do the higher paper.
attributes.additional_details: The highest grade you can get for Foundation maths is C and it's known that its much easier to get a C in higher. Most people in foundation maths could easily get a 8 or a 9 (A's). The paper should be equal.

attributes.action: Change PE back to 60% practical 40% theory
attributes.background: If it’s called physical education, why is there more theory then practical?

attributes.action: Devolve Corporation Tax to the Scottish Parliament
attributes.background: We want lower taxes for businesses in Scotland, which probably means lower corporation tax rather than lower income tax. So now, I call on the UK government to devolve corporation tax.
attributes.additional_details: If the Scottish Parliament had the power to set corporation tax at a lower rate, then it would encourage more businesses to move up to Scotland. In my opinion, this would probably suit a lot of businesses. And I would also call on all parties at Westminster to work together to achieve this.

attributes.action: Reduce income tax allowance discrepancy between UK worker & Tier2  employee
attributes.background:
A UK worker receives no taxfree allowance for paying utility bills, rent or council tax. Also, pays compulsory NI. 
A seconded worker under Tier2 Inter-Company Transfer scheme gets tax free allowance for paying utility bills, rents & council tax under Dispensation model plus optional NI for 2 years
attributes.additional_details:
ICT worker with £40,000 annual salary receives 20-40% of salary (£700-£1200 per month) as tax free allowance. 
E.g. Gross Pay=£40,000
Annual Income tax paid by ICT worker is £2,818.20
UK worker pays £9,518.52 
A normal UK worker pays 3 times the tax paid by a person on Tier2 seconded employee. Can government explain the reason behind this discrimination between UK & Non-UK employed person?  
Can government and HMRC explain what are the benefits of this system to the Great Britain & wider public?

attributes.action: Inquiry on collapse of Monarch & the safeguarding of pensions
attributes.background: There have been calls for a public inquiry to the collapse of Monarch airlines and maybe look into changing the law on pensions so when a company goes into administration money can be put aside for the pension fund.
attributes.additional_details: The Chair of Parliament’s Work and Pensions Committee expressed concern over claims that private equity group Greybull Capital could avoid losing money while the carrier’s pension fund – which is owed £7.5m – could be among creditors left with nothing.

attributes.action: Stop the land asset stripping of the NHS recommended in the Naylor report.
attributes.background: Forcing NHS trusts to sell off their valuable land to cover basic costs the government won't adequately is wrong. We don't need a private profit health service system as with the US. It is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Legalise plural marriage.
attributes.background: The people will be free to decide for themselves how many people they can marry.
attributes.additional_details: The government has no reason to involve itself in the love life of its citizens.

attributes.action: Immediate cap on fees charged by letting agents
attributes.background: The rental market is open to abuse by letting agents who can name their price; there is no correlation between the costs they incur and the fees charged. It's a free for all, with fees for the same processes widely differing for no apparent reason but to put more money in the pocket of the agent.
attributes.additional_details:
Do these examples seem fair?

Print & sign tenancy contract: £120
What does it really cost to print a document?

Credit check: £100
Credit checks typically cost less than £30

Moving in fee covering background & credit check: £395
That's £395 BEFORE you've even paid your rent & deposit. And if you 'fail' you lose your money.

We're not proposing scrapping the fees, after all the agents do incur costs. But a cap would give clarity for all, and prevent profiteering hitting renters in the pocket.

attributes.action: Lower the retirement age for frontline road and call takers ambulance staff
attributes.background: 65 is the retirement age for ambulance staff. This type of work is too much at this age. Carrying patients, 12 hour shifts, night shifts and the type of jobs we see. We have a high mortality rate. We need to be brought in line with fire staff and police staff.
attributes.additional_details: There is evidence that ambulance staff have a mortality rate of 2 years post retirement. At a time when our staff should be relaxing after caring so much for so many years many are being taken from us too early. Reduce the retirement age

attributes.action: Include awareness of emotional and physical abuse to the national curriculum
attributes.background: We're at a time in our lives and our society where abuse, emotional or physical, is being seen as normal. Children as young as even 10 or some younger are not able to recognise normal behaviour anymore and see abuse of any kind as normal. This needs to stop now, any age it's not acceptable.

attributes.action: Provide armed security for the Orthodox Jewish Community in the UK
attributes.background: European governments are providing armed security for synagogues and Jewish institutions following numerous fatal terror attacks. This is because where there is a serious risk of fatalities, the only feasible solution is to provide armed security for Jewish public places. The UK must do the same.
attributes.additional_details:
The Terror threat level in Europe is getting worse, with innocent people of all races being murdered. The threat to the Jewish community is always greater, in particular when elements of the media promote anti-semitic perspectives on the Middle East conflict. The Gov't Provides armed Police for Foreign embassies and must do the same for it's own citizens who need it.

It is impossible for a policeman or security guard without a weapon to protect sites from  terrorists armed with weapons.

attributes.action: Replace the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation
attributes.background: I believe that the ombudsman service just has not got the ability to handle complaints about financial services. There is evidence in the media and on online review services like trustpilot.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to consider replacing the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation that is not funded by, or affiliated with, the banks and other financial services.

attributes.action: Change The Colour Of Rear Vehicle Registration Plates To White
attributes.background: In many countries around the world registration plates on vehicles tend to be white at the front and white at the back. In the UK our rear plate is yellow, which spoils the appearance of our vehicles. White number plates would go with any body paintwork colour and this should be adopted.
attributes.additional_details: With our vehicles currently having a white registration plate at the front it would make sense to match this with a white registration plate at the back.

attributes.action: Create a national safeguarding database.
attributes.background: Too many safeguarding cases go under the radar and have unknown outcomes.  As the way things stand now; disclosures are made and followed up. If the parents are ‘caught’ they sometimes leave the setting/more to a new one or if more serious issue/move out of the area or can be lying and deceptive.
attributes.additional_details: To prevent this from happening there would be a national safeguarding and child protection database. This would have any safeguarding, child protection cases uploaded so that every local authority and council could see the case files and would be flagged up as soon as the family move in to the area. All professionals involved in the case would have access to the database to upload their case notes.

attributes.action: The Government Must Cut Waiting Times For Children’s Mental Health Services
attributes.background: We call on the government to tackle the mental health epidemic at the root, and fast - to do this it needs to cut waiting times for children (5-16 years old), shortening its timeline to introduce maximum waiting times by 2022-23. If not, our country will lose countless young lives in the meantime.
attributes.additional_details: On May 9 two committees of MPs published a report saying the government's plans will take too long to come into effect and will ‘fail a generation’. On average, a child waits a decade from the moment they suffer their first symptom of poor mental health to receiving treatment. At such a crucial stage in children's development, mental health issues should be treated as a matter of urgency. Diagnosing and treating issues early will help deal with problems before they develop into something worse.

attributes.action: Provide testing strips to all type 2 diabetics
attributes.background: Type 2 diabetics need to check blood sugar regardless of what medication they take or if diet controlled.

attributes.action: Remove swimming from the English national curriculum for school students.
attributes.background: Students across the country are being forced to do swimming even though they may be uncomfortable with swimming or struggle to do it. With the help of this petition, children will not be forced to something, which weekly, children are worrying about.

attributes.action: Safeguard public funds with full annual NAO risk audit on all outsourcers
attributes.background: The Government should change the law so that the NAO is given responsibly for auditing any company that wins Government contract worth more than £20 million and that any appropriate contract must include an agreement to be audited by the NAO and the results made public.
attributes.additional_details: As illustrated by Carillion and numerous other major corporate failures before it, the ‘Big Four’ independent audit opinion has been confirmed as inherently flawed.  There is an inherent risk in the ‘Big Four’ conducting annual audits of companies where senior management are ex-‘Big Four’ themselves.  A mutual understanding serves each party in this situation as well as the knowledge that any moral hazard contracts or companies are ultimately backed by the government and UK taxpayers.

attributes.action: Give disabled victims of crime funding for support & services to obtain justice!
attributes.background: Disabled people such as those suffering with Autism find dealing with stress and anxiety very difficult, especially when they are victims of crime, it has a huge negative impact on their health, their life both at work and at home as well as their mental well being.
attributes.additional_details: Adequate funding and support should always be available via a bespoke fund for those disabled victims such as autistics or those with mental disabilities ensuring their needs are met to provide the services and support required so the most vulnerable in our society, who struggle to cope with life in general, let alone when they are the victims of crime are not left alone to deal with courts, ombudsman, regulators, MP's, media and police plus all the paperwork and documentation it entails.

attributes.action: Debate diesel prices and car tax
attributes.background: Diesel prices: we were encouraged to buy a diesel car and now diesel prices and car tax are going up (and the roads are full of potholes). Electric cars are no good for towing and you have to sit about in services for a hour to recharge them.

attributes.action: Abolish prohibited lanes for HGV overtaking on M11 and A14.
attributes.background: These stretches of the M11 and A14 where overtaking for HGV’s is prohibited are completely counter productive. They serve to prevent HGV’s overtaking for long periods and inconveniencing other road users.
attributes.additional_details: In reality these lanes create long tailbacks as faster/unladen HGV’s have to queue behind other slower/laden vehicles uphill with reduced speeds of sometimes 25-30mph. When the restriction ends all the faster HGV’s accerlerate pull out into lane 2 to overtake. These lanes are a complete false economy and are dangerous.

attributes.action: Investigate the role of the Information Commission due to its ineffectiveness
attributes.background: Call for an investigation into the role of the ICO and why they refer the public back to, and do not act against, the public bodies/organisations who do not reply to data requests and maintain their silence in order to block/obstruct complaints. Urgent changes/reforms to the law need to be made
attributes.additional_details: Due to the advice by the petitions committee when rejecting 3 petitions - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/206379 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/205268 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/213769 we call on the government/Secretary of State to make appropriate provision to ensure that the Information Commission act to assist members of the public to obtain full disclosure of their records in order to pursue complaints further & ban public bodies from withholding records

attributes.action: Add 1p Income Tax & Reduce Aid to OECD average to create a BREXIT readiness fund
attributes.background: I believe the majority of British People support Foreign Aid spending but feel we are spending a bit too much currently. I also believe our Country is in need of Strategic Infrastructure and Business Support Spending to help us during the pre Brexit and immediate post Brexit period.

attributes.action: Raise the legal age to 25 for buying knives or blades of any type.
attributes.background: Children as young as 14 are carrying & using knives to harm others.The current age of 18 yrs is clearly not enough. Not everyone will adhere to a knife amnesty, nor will stop and search reach all.Raise the legal age to 25.Make it harder for them to obtain in the first place so less knives on streets

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow boys to wear shorts.
attributes.background: Most schools no longer give boys the option to wear shorts except when taking part in physical education however all schools allow girls to wear skirts. This is sexist and should be resolved by requiring schools to allow boys to wear shorts.

attributes.action: Cap the price of private and university owned student accommodation
attributes.background: Students are becoming more ripped off by the price of student accommodation each year thus becoming harder to live. It is already unfair that Student Finance dictate our maintenance loan based on our household income and the majority have to live in a student overdraft. We want fair reduced prices.

attributes.action: large vehicle awareness a mandatory part of obtaining a small vehicle licence
attributes.background: I feel that not enough people driving small vehicles are educated about the dangers of sharing the road with Heavy goods vehicles, Dangerous goods and long loads pose a threat to life if the proper information hasn't been given to all including those who are simply sharing the road.
attributes.additional_details: All I am asking is for people to be taught about what the signs mean on trucks that are designed to warn other road users of the dangers the vehicle poses. And for potential car licence holders to be educated on stopping times and blind spots of different vehicles. 75% of accidents between HGVs and cars are the car drivers fault and being given more awareness as part of a small vehicle licence could drastically improve those figures and even save lives!

attributes.action: Introduce Religious Studies/ REPS as an EBacc humanity subject
attributes.background: So many of us at our school have been restricted due to being forced to do EBacc. We only get given 4 choices, 2 of which have to be a language or a humanity, either history or geography. Many students want to do RS but cannot due to limited options.
attributes.additional_details: Religious, Ethical and Philosophical Studies (REPS) is an academically challenging subject that it much more interesting and useful for many school students than History or Geography. It encourages debate and gives us the freedom to express our views. It also improves essay writing skills important to other GCSEs such as English, further developing us there, and gives us the knowledge and ability to discuss current affairs and issues, in addition to past issues like history.

attributes.action: Do not make any changes to the current devolution arrangements
attributes.background: In 1997, the people of Scotland voted very decisively to have a devolved Scottish Parliament and devolved powers as well, and they are within an EU framework. But now, the UK government is planning a ‘power grab’ on these areas such as agriculture, farming and fishing.
attributes.additional_details: So I call on the UK government not to change the current devolution settlement. They say it will be more expensive to have different sets of rules, but I don’t agree with them. If they want a UK-wide framework, then maybe they could look towards having a federalised framework rather than a ‘power grab’.

attributes.action: The abolition of Audit total exemption for small private limited companies.
attributes.background: This provision is being severely abused by many claiming that their retained annual profit is around £200 - £2,000, totally unrealistic, and is costing the Treasury and the NHS billions of pounds in loss revenue and, above all, nothing is done about it.
